intro: Luzula rufa, commonly known as red tussock sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and dense, reddish-brown flowering spikes that appear in late summer. Luzula rufa typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of ecological systems, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
